thread.title: American opts out of commercial service to Athens airport
thread.title_full: American opts out of commercial service to Athens airport

author: Carla Caldwell
title: American opts out of commercial service to Athens airport
text:
Mark Elias | Bloomberg American Airlines Group Inc. says a shortage of planes and pilots persuaded the carrier… more American Airlines Group Inc. (Nasdaq: AAL) will not operate planned commercial air service out of Athens-Ben Epps Airport after all. American, which would have provided service through US Airways , with which American recently merged, said a shortage of both planes and pilots prompted the carrier to drop plans to expand service in Athens and other parts of Georgia, reports Athens Banner-Herald. American was also considering providing service from airports in Macon and Columbus, Athens-Ben Epps Airport Director Tim Beggerly told his city's airport authority at its Tuesday meeting. Beggerly said learning Tuesday that US Airways Express will not operate at the airport is a significant blow, the paper reports. “We need to drop back and regroup,” Beggerly told authority members. “I know it’s a setback, but hopefully it’s a temporary setback.”
